alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kennebec, east central Oxford, Androscoggin, north central Cumberland and northwestern Sagadahoc Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Livermore Falls, or 12 miles northeast of Turner, moving south at 15 mph. Additional strong storms could develop as outflow boundaries merge together. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Augusta, Gardiner, Mechanic Falls, Turner, Litchfield, Belgrade, Livermore Falls, Farmingdale, Manchester, Hallowell, Winthrop, Lisbon, Greene, Durham, Bowdoin, Bowdoinham, Chelsea and Leeds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 43 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 71 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford
